This Blue Canister is plainly visible to the left of your starting point.








Part 4 - Helmet Hijinks

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is also in plain sight as you enter this area.








Part 5 - Small Hallway

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the hallway.








Part 6 - Grappling Fun

Blue Canister 7
After grappling across the first gap, head through the door to find this Blue Canister in front of the Hat Machine.







Part 7 - Bait and Switch

Blue Canister 8
In the room where you are overwhelmed by stormtroopers, there are two doorways where the troopers come from. Head inside the door on the left to find this Blue Canister.






Blue Canister 9
Similar to the previous Blue Canister, this Blue Canister is in the door on the right.








Part 8 - Ben's Sacrifice

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found to the right of the Astromech panel on the right side of the Falcon.
Rebel Attack - Story Mode
With the Death Star plans in their hands at last, the Rebel Alliance plans a desperate assault on the Imperial space station.

But a hidden homing beacon attached to the Millennium Falcon has led Darth Vader to the Rebel's secret base on the moon of Yavin IV.

The moon will soon be in the range of the mighty Death Star's superlaser. Now, a small band of fearless pilots bear with them the hopes of an entire galaxy....

Enemies: TIE Fighter
Starting Vehicles: X-wing
True Jedi: 30,000

Part 1 – Death Star Assault

You can’t fly around too much because you are boxed in by a shield. Flying close to the shield will reveal a torpedo target. Grab a torpedo from the nearby torpedo generator, then use it to destroy the target. This will lower the shield, allowing you to fly into the larger clearing.

Head into the clearing and you’ll notice your path is once again blocked by a shield. There are a bunch of red lines leading away from the shield. Follow the lines and you’ll reveal four torpedo targets. Grab torpedoes and destroy the targets to lower the shield, then blast your way through the barrier and continue on.

Part 2 – Death Star Surface

This part is the same as the first, just in a larger area. Follow the red lines away from the shield to find 8 torpedo targets. Destroy them to lower the shield, then shoot and destroy the barrier, allowing you to continue.

Part 3 – Death Star Turrets

This section is identical to the previous two. Destroy the torpedo targets to lower the shield, then destroy the barrier. Fly towards the trench to begin your trench run!

Part 4 – The Trench Run

After the cutscene, you’ll find yourself being chased by Vader and two TIEs. If you turn around and fire on the escorts, you can actually score hits on them and eventually destroy them. You can’t destroy Vader though. You’ll be given one torpedo as you enter the trench, so avoid the fire from the TIE Fighters until you reach the end of the trench. Once you reach the end of the trench, a cutscene will play.

After the cutscene, you’ll find yourself at the exhaust port. Before you can destroy it, you need to destroy the defenses. There are 12 turrets that will appear when you fly close to them. Expose and destroy the turrets and the final torpedo target will appear. If you need a torpedo, a generator can be found at the beginning of the trench. Destroy the torpedo target to destroy the Death Star and complete the level.

Unlocked Vehicles: Y-wing, TIE Fighter (35,000), TIE Interceptor (40,000), TIE Fighter (Darth Vader) (50,000)

You will also unlock the X-wing if you haven't already
Rebel Attack - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: TIE, Tow Cable

Part 1 - Death Star Assault

Canister 1
After you fly past the first shield, you'll notice a "+" looking shape on the left side of the Death Star's surface.







Fly close to it to reveal a large rotary handle.









Shoot it a couple of times to reveal a cage, then destroy it to receive this Canister.








Canister 2
To the left of the second shield is a TIE Gate. Fly up to it as a TIE Fighter to open it.








Inside you'll find a torpedo target. Destroy it to reveal the cage with this Canister inside. Shoot it to collect it.







Canister 3
On the right side of the area, you'll find a series of four blue rectangular panels. Destroy them to reveal an alcove with a cage inside. Destroy the cage to receive this Canister.






Part 2 - Death Star Surface

Canister 4
On the right side of the area is a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it. Here, you'll see this Canister inside a cage, which is behind a shield. You'll have to shut off the shield to collect the Canister.





Head back down the Death Star's surface and you'll find a smaller TIE Gate. Open it and you'll reveal a bomb dispenser.







Latch onto a bomb (both of the TIE Gates will stay open for you) and drag it back into the orange panels on each side of the shield. You'll need two bombs, one for each side. Destroy the orange panels to lower the shield around this Canister, allowing you to collect it.




Canister 5
Destroy these four blue rectangular panels by the TIE Gate on the right side of the area to reveal an alcove with a cage inside. Destroy the cage to receive this Canister.






Canister 6
There is a "+" shape by the TIE Gate on the left of the area. Fly near it to reveal a large rotary handle, then shoot it to reveal a cage. Destroy it to receive this Canister.






Canister 7
There is a TIE Gate on the left side of the area. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it.








Inside you'll find a series of green lights. Fly over them in quick succession to reveal the cage with this Canister inside.







Part 3 - Death Star Turrets

Canister 8
There is a "+" shape on the left side of the area. Fly near it to reveal a large rotary handle, then shoot it to reveal a cage. Destroy it to receive this Canister.







Canister 9
After destroying the barrier to leave this area, carefully fly through. On the left, you'll see more blue rectangular panels. Destroy them to reveal an alcove with a cage inside (you can't see it, but it's there). Destroy the cage to receive this Canister.





Part 4 - The Trench Run

Canister 10
There is a "+" shape on the left side of the exhaust port. Fly near it to reveal a large rotary handle, then shoot it to reveal a cage. Destroy it to receive this Canister.






Red Power Brick (Score x2)
You can barely see this Brick to the right of my X-wing. This Power Brick is tucked inside an alcove to the right of the exhaust port.







Minikit Model: TIE Advanced
Rebel Attack - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: TIE

Part 1 - Death Star Assault

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister is immediately to the right of your starting point.








Blue Canister 2
After passing the first shield, you can find this Blue Canister on the right by a turbolaser turret.








Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister is tucked away in a corner on the right side of the area.








Blue Canister 4
There is a TIE Gate on the left side of the area. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside. You'll find this Blue Canister by the torpedo target.






Part 2 - Death Star Surface

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the area, before the torpedo targets. It can be found tucked between three turbolaser turrets.







Blue Canister 6
There is a TIE Gate on the left side of the area. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside.







You will find this Blue Canister tucked behind a small tower at the end of the green lights.








Blue Canister 7
There is a small TIE Gate on the right side of the area. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, and you'll find this Blue Canister to the right of the bomb dispenser.






Part 3 - Death Star Turrets

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is to the left of your starting point, between some turbolaser turrets.








Part 4 - The Trench Run

Blue Canister 9
Turn around and head back down the trench. You'll find this Blue Canister at the end of the path.








Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is at the very end of the trench past the exhaust port.
Character Bonus - Mos Eisley
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

In the sprawling alleyways of Mos Eisley, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

I personally find this to be one of the easier Character Bonuses. There are plenty of large silver moisture vaporators for you to destroy, and most of them will spit out Power Ups. Take advantage of the Power Ups to quickly rack up your stud total. There are plenty of enemies to defeat, and since the streets are so compact, the studs won't bounce around too much, making collection a breeze.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
Minikit Bonus - Death Star
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

On the deadly surface of the Death Star, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

There are plenty of torpedo targets on the surface of the Death Star for you to destroy. Destroying the white tower things will give you Power Ups, although they can sometimes be difficult to collect. Destroying some of the smaller satellites will also reveal Power Ups occasionally. There is also a large object you can destroy by hitting the four torpedo targets surrounding it, which will give you a lot of studs. Watch out for the TIEs who will constantly be bugging you.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
--Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back--
Hoth Battle - Story Mode
It is a dark time for the Rebellion. Although the Death Star has been destroyed, Imperial troops have driven them from their hidden base and pursued them across the galaxy.

Evading the dreaded Imperial Starfleet, a group of freedom fighters led by Luke Skywalker has established a new secret base on the remote ice world of Hoth.

The evil lord Darth Vader, obsessed with finding young Skywalker, has dispatched thousands of remote probes into the far reaches of space....

Enemies: AT-ST, Imperial Probe Droid, Imperial Speeder Bike, AT-AT
Starting Vehicles: Snowspeeder
True Jedi: 25,000

Part 1 – Hoth Snow Fields

Your goal in this area is to enter the cave with the very subtle red arrow pointed at it. The only problem is, it’s sealed. To unseal it, grab a bomb from one of the two dispensers in the area. Latch onto it with your tow cable and drag it all the way to the cave entrance.

Watch out for the probe droids. When you are dragging a bomb, they will sometimes latch onto it, slowing you down. Simply turn around and shoot them to unhook them from the bomb. Launch the bomb at the barrier to destroy it, then head inside the cave.

Part 2 – Walker Assault

There are two AT-ATs in this area, and we need to take them out. We’ll need bombs to do that, but one of the AT-ATs is spamming fire at the bomb dispenser. As soon as you take a bomb, the AT-AT will shoot it and detonate it. To fix this, latch onto the legs of the first walker and fly laps around it until it falls. Grab a bomb and tow it into the AT-AT to destroy it.

That is how you take out the AT-ATs. Latch onto the legs, fly around them, bomb them when they fall. If you take to long to bomb them, they will stand back up and you'll have to topple them again.

Take out the second AT-AT to melt the piles of snow, revealing a barrier. Tow a bomb into it to destroy it, then do the same for the next large barrier (be careful dragging the bomb up the narrow slope). After both barriers are clear, you can continue through the archway.

Part 3 – Imperial Onslaught

In this section, you will be faced with four waves of enemies. Defeat each wave to send in the next one. The first wave consists of 11 Imperial Probe Droids. The second wave consists of 11 AT-STs. The third wave consists of 2 AT-ATs. The final wave consists of 1 AT-AT, 4 Probe Droids, and 6 AT-STs. Defeat all the enemies to complete the level.

Unlocked Vehicles: Snowspeeder
Hoth Battle - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: TIE, Tow Cable

Part 1 - Hoth Snow Fields

Canister 1
When you fly close to the AT-STs, you will be able to latch onto them with your tow cable. Do so, then fly away from them to knock them down.







Knock down 10 AT-STs using this method and this Canister will appear by the exit.








Canister 2
On the left side of the area, you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it up, then head inside.







You'll find a barrier, so drag a bomb into it to destroy it, revealing a cave.








Fly inside and you'll witness some snowspeeders being trapped by some AT-STs and speeders.








Defeat all the attacking Imperials to reveal this Canister.








Canister 3
After collecting Canister 2, head back out of the tunnel. You'll find a rock on the right side of the tunnel entrance. Destroy it and you'll reveal this Canister hiding behind it.






Canister 4
This Canister is hidden inside a container behind the small barrier on the right.








Part 2 - Walker Assault

Canister 5
Much like the first area, use your tow cable to latch onto 10 AT-STs and pull them down.








Canister 6
There is a TIE Gate on the left side of the bomb dispenser. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside.







Head to the left and you'll see the entrance to a tunnel.








Fly down the tunnel and you'll see a container on the left. Destroy it to receive this Canister.








Canister 7
After collecting Canister 6, continue down the tunnel and out the other side. Head to the left and you'll find some rocks. Destroy them to reveal this Canister, which was hidden inside.






Red Power Brick (Self destruct)
After collecting Canister 7, continue to the right and you'll find this Red Brick behind a barrier. You'll have to drag a bomb all the way from the entrance of the tunnel to destroy the barrier. On the way to the barrier you'll pass an AT-AT. You'll have to topple it before destroying the barrier, otherwise it'll shoot and destroy your bomb.



Canister 8
This Canister can be found inside a container to the right of the narrow slope you have to drag the bomb up.







Part 3 - Imperial Onslaught

Canister 9
This Canister can be found inside a container hiding behind rocks to the right of your starting point. You can just barely see it in this screenshot.







Canister 10
This Canister can be found inside a container hiding behind rocks to the left of your starting point. You can just barely see it in this screenshot.







Minikit Model: AT-AT
Hoth Battle - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: TIE, Tow Cable

Part 1 - Hoth Snow Fields

Blue Canister 1
Head to the left and you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then continue on.








You'll find this Blue Canister on the left side of the area.








Blue Canister 2
After collecting Blue Canister 1, continue along the path and you'll run into a barrier.








Destroy it to reveal a cave.









Fly inside and you'll find this Blue Canister on the left side of the room.








Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be found to the left of the exit by the power generators.








Part 2 - Walker Assault

Blue Canister 4
To the left of the bomb dispenser is a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside.







You'll find this Blue Canister immediately to the right.








Blue Canister 5
After collecting Blue Canister 4, head to the left and you'll find a tunnel.








Fly inside and you'll find this Blue Canister on the right.








Blue Canister 6
After collecting Blue Canister 5, continue down the tunnel and you'll emerge in another clearing. Head to the right and you'll find this Blue Canister behind a barrier. You'll have to drag a bomb all the way through the tunnel and into this barrier to destroy it. Make sure to topple the AT-AT first, as it'll shoot at and detonate your bomb.



Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is hidden in a rock in front of the second AT-AT.








Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister can be found in an alcove to the right of the narrow slope you drag a bomb up.








Part 3 - Imperial Onslaught

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister is by some rocks to the right of your starting point.








Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is by some rocks to the left of your starting point.
Escape from Echo Base - Story Mode
Imperial forces have mounted a relentless assault on the Rebel base on Hoth. The Rebel fighters have held out bravely, but the enemy is overwhelming.

In the Echo Base command center, carved deep into the ice of the frozen planet, Han Solo and Princess Leia monitor the evacuation of Rebel personnel.

But as Stormtroopers breach the outer defenses, they must quickly find an escape route for themselves....

Enemies: Snowtrooper
Starting Characters: Han Solo (Hoth), Princess Leia (Hoth)
Added Characters: C-3PO, Chewbacca
True Jedi: 40,000

Part 1 – Echo Base Command Center

Time to get outta here. Head to the right towards the door. As you approach, there will be a rockslide, blocking off the door. Fortunately, some LEGO pieces have appeared as well. Build them into a bomb, which will detonate and destroy the rubble, allowing you to continue down the hallway.

Head down the hall and you’ll find another door completely covered in ice. Build the LEGO pieces into a heater, then shoot it a few times to power it up, melting the ice and opening the door. Head inside.

Part 2 – Echo Base Cafeteria

Head to the right and you’ll find two snowtroopers warming themselves on the heater. Push the heater along the tiles and onto the red panel. This will melt the ice on the door, opening it.

Continue down the hallway and you’ll run into a bunch of snowtroopers. One of them will be on an E-web blaster, which you can shoot to destroy. The way ahead is blocked by a Protocol panel, and the path on the left is blocked off by snow, so head to the right and you’ll find a bunch of boxes. Shoot them all to reveal a door, then head inside.

Part 3 – Circular Track

In this room you’ll find a cart on a track. Build the LEGO pieces onto the cart and it will start moving around the track. Turn the rotary handle to switch the track. When the cart hits the junction, it will head back out into the hallway and destroy the ice and snow blocking the path to the left. Head back out the door.

Part 2 – Echo Base Cafeteria

Head to the left down the previously blocked hallway and you’ll find 3PO. Now that we can use the Protocol panel, it’s time to uncover it. Rebuild the E-web blaster, then hop in and shoot at the blue barrier to destroy it. Watch out, as rebuilding the blaster will send in a new squad of snowtroopers! Use the Protocol panel to open the door, then head inside.

Part 4 – Tiled Hangar

The goal in this area is to get through the door on the right, which is unfortunately blocked off by a blue barrier. Head to the right and defeat the snowtroopers and destroy the E-webs. Once the troopers are toast, rebuild one of the E-webs and use it to destroy the blue barrier. This will reveal some LEGO pieces, which you can build into a Protocol panel. Unfortunately, the panel is on a ledge, which 3PO can’t reach. We need to find a way to get him up here.

Head back to the center of the hangar and destroy the two grey boxes to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a snowmobile. Now, you need to get 3PO onto the back of the snowmobile. Push the boxes on the tiles into the slots. This will power up the fans in the floor.

Hop in the snowmobile and drive up close to one of the fans. 3PO will go into the fan, where he will be boosted up and hopefully land on the back of the snowmobile. Once he’s on the back of the snowmobile, drive over to the ledge and press the “special” button to launch him onto the ledge. He can now use the Protocol panel to open the door, so do so.

Once the door is open, continue down the hallway, watching out for the falling platforms. Build the LEGO pieces at the end of the hallway into a bomb, which will explode and clear the rubble. Head through the door.

Part 5 – Slippery Slope

Head to the left and up the slope. Your goal is to open the door at the base of the slope, and to do that you need to hit each of the buttons. Slide down and hit as many buttons as you can. You don’t need to hit all five at the same time. You can take as long as you need, as the buttons won't become un-pressed. Once all the buttons have been pressed, the door will open. Head inside.

Part 6 – Medical Bay

Destroy the grey boxes to reveal four buttons. You need to step on all four to open the door. Since there are only three of you, push one of the boxes onto a button, then step on another button. Your partners will step on the other two, opening the door. Head down the hallway, then through the door at the end.

Part 7 – Hangar

Chewie has been added to the group, just in time to escape this place. The Millennium Falcon is here, guarded by two E-web turrets. Destroy them, then rebuild one. Hop in and use it to destroy the two shield generators. This will give you access to the Falcon, but we’ll need to make repairs before we can take off.

Build the LEGO pieces on the ground onto the docking ramp. There are more LEGO pieces on top of the Falcon, but we have no way to reach them. Fortunately, there are some Tauntauns nearby.

Head to the right and pull the levers to open the garage, revealing two boxes. Push them across the hangar and into the slots in front of the Tauntauns. This will open up the garage, allowing you to hop onto a Tauntaun. Ride over to the Falcon, then hop off. Build the LEGO pieces into a turret. Once both repairs are made, the ramp will open, so head inside to complete this level.

Unlocked Characters: Han Solo (Hoth), Princess Leia (Hoth), Han Solo (Hood) (20,000), Rebel Trooper (Hoth) (16,000), Rebel Pilot (15,000), Snowtrooper (16,000), Luke Skywalker (Hoth) (14,000)

You will also unlock C-3PO and Chewbacca if you haven’t already
Escape from Echo Base - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Echo Base Command Center

Canister 1
There are four computers in the command center.









If you Force the LEGO pieces on them, the screen will change to the image of a Canister.








Force all four consoles and this Canister will appear.








Part 2 - Echo Base Cafeteria

Canister 2
In the room where you encounter C-3PO, you'll find two silver objects.








Destroy them both to reveal two piles of LEGO pieces. Build them into heaters, then shoot them both a bunch to turn them on, melting the ice around you.






This will reveal two more piles of LEGO pieces.









Build them into two skeletons, then step on one of the buttons. Your partner and the skeletons will step on the other three, revealing this Canister.







Part 3 - Circular Track

Canister 3
This Canister can be found on the ledge to the right. You can either double jump up here, or hop on top of the cart and use it as a boost.







Part 4 - Tiled Hangar

Canister 4
On the right side of this area, before the E-webs, you'll find an alcove.








Inside, you'll find an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.








Inside you'll find some snowtroopers ice fishing. Force the LEGO pieces out of the hole on the left to reveal the LEGO pieces for this Canister.







Canister 5
This Canister can be found floating in the air in the center of the room. Simply double jump up to reach it.







Canister 6
On the right side of the hangar is a grey container partially stuck in ice. If you try to destroy it by shooting at it, nothing happens.







Hop in an E-web and aim it to the right, then shoot around.








You will eventually hit the container, destroying it and revealing this Canister in an alcove. If you are having trouble hitting the container, you can always toss a thermal detonator at it to destroy it.






Canister 7
On the left side of the room, you'll find some LEGO pieces. Force them into a snowman, which will clear the path to the left.







Head inside the room and you'll see this Canister floating in the air. To reach it, you'll have to restore the power to the fan.







Head back to the main room and push one of the boxes all the way to the left and into the room. Push the box into the slot by the fan to power it up, then ride the air current to this Canister.






Part 6 - Medical Bay

Canister 8
On the left side of the first room is a Protocol panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.








The path to the left is blocked by some silver rubble.








Destroy it, then continue to the left. The door on the right is locked and won't open. To open it, destroy the box. Once the door is open, head inside.







Build the LEGO pieces into a console to empty the bacta tank, allowing you to collect this Canister.








Canister 9
On your way to the hangar, you'll notice some wall panels on the left. Sith Force them into platforms, then hop up them. Be careful, as the panels are surrounded by ice. If you miss a jump, you'll slide back down to the bottom.





Once you're at the top, you'll come to a fork in the road. Head to the left, then head inside the door.








Inside the room you'll find a grapple point. Use it to reach a new area.








You'll see this Canister in the dome on the right. Crawl through the nearby travel chute to reach it.
Escape from Echo Base - Free Play Mode cont.
Red Power Brick (Fast build)
After collecting Canister 9, return to the fork in the road. This time take a right, and you'll find an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.






On the left side of the room you'll find a lever. Pull it to try your luck on the slot machine. You want the panels to display a red-and-white circle. You may have to try a few times before you get the symbols. Once you get the symbols to appear, the garage with those symbols over it in the hangar will open up, revealing this Power Brick.



Canister 10
Once you open the garage with the Power Brick behind it, head to the right side of the room and do the same with this lever. Getting the symbols (this time green-and-yellow) to appear will open the garage in the hangar with this Canister behind it.





Minikit Model: Snowspeeder
Escape from Echo Base - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Protocol, Sith Force, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Echo Base Command Center

Blue Canister 1
Use the Astromech panel to the left of your starting point to open the door.








Head inside and you'll find this Blue Canister next to the Hat Machine.








Part 3 - Circular Track

Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found on the ledge above the cart's initial position.








Part 2 - Echo Base Cafeteria

Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the room where you find 3PO. You'll have to send the cart from Part 3 into the snow and ice to clear the way inside.






Part 4 - Tiled Hangar

Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the hangar.








Blue Canister 5
There is a little alcove on the right side of the hangar. You can find it to the right of the slots for the boxes.







In it you'll find an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.








You'll find this Blue Canister in the right side of the room.








Part 5 - Slippery Slope

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is in plain sight on the ice slope.









Part 6 - Medical Bay

Blue Canister 7
Use the Protocol panel on the left side of the room to open the door. Head inside.








Destroy the silver rubble on the left to clear the path.








Continue into the alcove, then destroy this box to open the door to the right.








Head into the room, where you'll find this in the near left corner.








Blue Canister 8
As you approach the door to the hangar, you'll see some black panels on the wall to the left. Sith Force them into platforms, then carefully hop up them.







You'll find this Blue Canister at the top of the slope.









Blue Canister 9
After collecting Blue Canister 8, head to the right and you'll find an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door.







Head inside and you'll find this Blue Canister in front of the window overlooking the hangar.








Part 7 - Hangar

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found next to the boxes. Pull the levers to open the garage, allowing you to collect it.
Falcon Flight - Story Mode
Led by the evil Darth Vader, Imperial forces have overrun the Rebel base on the ice planet of Hoth.

Having bravely stalled the enemy advance, Luke Skywalker has made his escape by X-wing fighter.

And as the last Rebel transports lift off from the planet, Han Solo in the Millennium Falcon engages the Imperial ships above....

Enemies: TIE Fighter, TIE Interceptor, TIE Bomber
Starting Vehicles: Millennium Falcon
True Jedi: 30,000

Part 1 – Rebel Rescue

Looks like some of the rebel transports got caught by Star Destroyers. We’ve got to help them out! Each of the Star Destroyers has four turrets on it. Destroy all of the turrets and you’ll rescue the transports.

Part 2 – The Asteroid Field

Your goal is to continue through the asteroid field. Unfortunately, your path will be blocked off by some rubble. There are four torpedo targets on the rubble that you need to destroy, but there are no torpedo generators in the area. You'll have to find some torpedoes.

To do so, destroy the small asteroids littered throughout the area. Most of them will reveal torpedoes when they are destroyed. The asteroids will respawn, so you don’t have to worry about using your torpedoes wisely. Once all four targets are destroyed, the path will be cleared, so continue on.

Part 3 – Asteroid Surface

This area is much the same as the first. The path ahead is blocked by rubble, so get torpedoes from the asteroids and use them to destroy the four torpedo targets.

Once the path is cleared, continue onto the surface of the asteroid. You’ll find your path once again blocked by rubble, so destroy the four torpedo targets to clear the path. With the path clear, continue into the asteroid field.

Part 4 – On the Attack

Your path back to the Star Destroyers is blocked by one massive asteroid, so grab torpedoes from the smaller asteroids and use them to destroy the targets. Once all six torpedo targets have been destroyed, the asteroid will explode. Head towards the Star Destroyers to complete the level.

Unlocked Vehicles: TIE Bomber (60,000), Imperial Shuttle (25,000)

You will also unlock the Millennium Falcon and X-wing if you haven’t already
Falcon Flight - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: TIE, Tow Cable

Part 1 - Rebel Rescue

Red Power Brick (Score x4)
This Red Power Brick is barely visible behind the bridge of the right center Star Destroyer.








Canister 1
This Canister can be found behind the bridge of the far right Star Destroyer.








Part 2 - The Asteroid Field

Canister 2
On the left side of the asteroid field, you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside.







Inside, you'll find a bomb dispenser. Grab a bomb and tow it into this red panel on the left to reveal a cage with this Canister inside. Be careful when towing the bomb. You don't want it to fall into one of the craters.





Canister 3
After collecting Canister 2, grab another bomb and tow it into the red panel on the right to reveal a cage with this Canister inside.







Canister 4
This Canister is on the left side of the asteroid field.









Part 3 - Asteroid Surface

Canister 5
This Canister is on the right side of the asteroid field.








Canister 6
On the left side of the asteroid surface, you'll find a TIE Gate. Fly up to it with a TIE Fighter to open it, then head inside.







You'll find a torpedo target inside the alcove. Destroy it to receive this Canister.








Canister 7
Destroy the torpedo target on the left side of the surface of the asteroid to receive this Canister.








Canister 8
Similar to the previous Canister, destroy the torpedo target on the right side of the surface of the asteroid to receive this Canister.







Canister 9
To the right of the exit, you'll find a hole. Fly up to it to drop down inside it.








We're in a cave right? Totally a cave! Fly down the "cave" and you'll reach a small alcove.








Destroy the container on the right side of the alcove to receive this Canister. You can also destroy the objects in here for torpedoes if you need some.







Part 4 - On the Attack

Canister 10
As soon as you enter this area, head back to the right and you'll notice this small asteroid.








Destroy it to reveal this Canister, which was hidden behind it.








Minikit Model: TIE Fighter
Falcon Flight - Challenge Mode
Part 1 - Rebel Rescue

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found in front of the bridge of the center left Star Destroyer.








Part 2 - The Asteroid Field

Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister appears behind the rubble once you destroy it.








Part 3 - Asteroid Surface

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is on the right side of the surface of the asteroid.








Part 4 - On the Attack

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the asteroid field.








Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the asteroid field.
Dagobah - Story Mode
Han Solo and Princess Leia have finally evaded the Imperial fleet in the Millennium Falcon, and are on their way to Cloud City - secretly followed by the bounty hunter Boba Fett.

Meanwhile, following instructions relayed to him by the spectral form of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Luke Skywalker has piloted his X-wing to the forgotten planet of Dagobah.

Accompanied by his trusty droid R2-D2, Luke heads towards the murky swamp world in search of his destiny....

Enemies: Bat, Snake
Boss: Darth Vader
Starting Characters: Luke Skywalker (Pilot), R2-D2
Added Characters: Luke Skywalker (Dagobah), Yoda
True Jedi: 52,000

Part 1 – Dagobah Swamps

We’ve crashed on Dagobah, and are now searching for Yoda. Watch out for the water. It may look friendly and inviting, but Luke will die as soon as he touches it. R2 however, will be just fine. Build the LEGO pieces into two ramps, allowing R2 to join you on the upper ledge, then continue down the path.

You’ll find yourself in a swamp. R2 can pass through the water to reach the other side, but not Luke. You’ll have to find another way to cross. Destroy the green plant on the far right to reveal a grapple point, then use it to swing across the gap.

Continue to the left and you’ll reach a gap. Have R2 hover across the gap, then use the Astromech panel to raise a bridge, allowing Luke to join you. Blast your way through the plants, then continue to the left.

Part 2 – Yoda’s Hut

You can see Yoda’s hut in the distance, so to reach it, build the LEGO pieces into a button. Step on it to reveal another button above the water. Hover over to it, then step on it to reveal another button behind you. Step on it to reveal another button ahead of you. Hover over to it and step on it to reveal another button behind you. Step on it to reveal another platform in front of you, allowing you to hop onto the opposite shore. Approach Yoda’s hut to trigger a cutscene.

Part 3 – Training Grounds

You are now in the training grounds, and you have Luke in his Dagobah outfit (complete with lightsaber). Luke is currently learning about the Force, so he cannot use it by himself. In order to use the Force, he’ll need Yoda to hop onto his back. Simply walk up to Yoda and hit the “tag” button and he’ll hop onto Luke’s back.

You can now Force and destroy all of the plants in the area to reveal three piles of LEGO pieces. Force them into the water to create a bridge, then cross it. You’ll find another set of buttons to the right, so hop on the first button to reveal another, etc. Step on the buttons to cross the water and you’ll find the gate out of here.

The Astromech panel to open the gate is high up on a platform. To reach it, Force both of the mushroom things on the right to lower them down. Get onto the top of the one on the right as R2, then wait for it to raise up. Hover over to the mushroom on the left, then wait for it to raise up as well. Once it’s raised up, you can hover over to the left and land on the platform with the Astromech panel. Use it to open the gate, then head inside.

Part 2 – Yoda’s Hut

It doesn’t look like it, but we’re actually in the same area we were in before. If you head towards the screen, you’ll head back down the path and reach Yoda’s Hut. As soon as you enter this area, Luke will Force a rock. He can now use the Force by himself, and you can also play as Yoda if you wish.

Head to the left and you’ll find a tree. Force the LEGO pieces out of the water to reveal a tractor, then Force the trailer to create a ramp. This will allow R2 to reach the first platform, where he can hover to the left to cross the gap. Do so, then use the Astromech panel to raise up a platform, allowing Luke and Yoda to join you. Continue to the left and destroy the barrier, then head inside the cave.

Part 4 – The Cave

Time to face the power of the Dark Side. Head down the slope and hop on the first platform with the button. Step on the button to lower the platform, then hop onto the next button. This will lower the platforms and create bridges, allowing your partners to join you. Cross the bridge onto the next ledge, then hop onto the platform with the button. This will lower the platform and reveal more bridges, allowing you to cross to the next ledge.

Cross the bridge and continue to the right, carefully hopping across the ledges. Eventually you’ll be back on solid ground, so head up the slope and you’ll come face to face with Darth Vader. Or rather, an apparition of Vader.

Duel him to take out two hearts. He will then retreat onto the ledge on the left. Hop on one of the boxes and your partner will hop on the other. Force the box your partner is on to raise them up. They will do the same to you, allowing you to reach the upper ledge. Hop off and duel Vader to take out two more hearts.

He will then retreat to the ledge on the right. Drop back down and head to the right, then build the LEGO pieces into a box. Force all three boxes into position, then hop up them to reach the ledge. Duel Vader to take out two more hearts. He will then retreat back to ground level. Drop back down and take out his last two hearts. This will open the gate in the back of the area. Head on through.

Part 5 – Crashed X-wing

Head to the right and you’ll find the LEGO pieces for a rotary handle underneath some plants. Force them to destroy them, then build the LEGO pieces into a rotary handle. Turn it to raise up a bridge, allowing you to cross the gap. Force the LEGO pieces into a ramp, then continue on.

Head to the left and you’ll find two black boxes. Hop on one and your partner will hop on the other. Force the box your partner is on and they will do the same to you, lifting you up onto the ledge. Hop onto the ledge and push the box along the tiles and off the edge. This will reveal some LEGO pieces below.

Drop down and build them into an Astromech panel, then use it to destroy the barrier. You’ll find Luke’s X-wing sunk into the swamp. You need to Force it out. If you Force it as Luke, you’ll be unable to lift it out of the swamp. Force it as Yoda to lift it out of the swamp, completing the level.

Unlocked Characters: Luke Skywalker (Pilot), Luke Skywalker (Dagobah)

You will also unlock R2-D2 and Yoda if you haven’t already
Dagobah - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Force, Grapple, Hover, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Dagobah Swamps

Canister 1
There are three blue boxes around your starting area.








Force them into a tower, then hop up it. You'll see this Canister on the right. Hop onto the nearby tree branch, then hover across the gap to reach this Canister.






Red Power Brick (Regenerate Hearts)
As you approach the swamp, you'll see a black barrier on the right.








Sith Force the plants and the barrier to destroy it, clearing the path.








Hover across the gap and you'll reach a racetrack. You'll find a blue box on the racetrack.








Destroy it to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a tractor.








Hop in and ride it around the racetrack, quickly activating the 10 small red buttons. Once all 10 buttons have been activated, this Power Brick will appear.






Canister 2
In the center of the swamp is a box. You can reach it by hovering across the islands.








Destroy the box to reveal this Canister.









Part 2 - Yoda's Hut

Canister 3
You can go inside Yoda's hut. To do so, you'll need a small character or an Astromech droid.








Once inside the hut, head to the left to find Yoda's TV. Sith Force it to destroy it, revealing this Canister.







Canister 4
On the right side of Yoda's hut is a red box. Sith Force it to reveal LEGO pieces.








Build them into a raft, then hop on to catch a ride to the next island.








Hop onto the island and head to the left, where you'll find some silver rubble. Destroy it to reveal this Canister.







Canister 5
Use the grapple point right before the entrance to the cave to reach the ledge with this Canister.








Part 3 - Training Grounds

Canister 6
There are 3 circular pods in this area. Attack each of them to open them up and release bats. You need to open all 3. The first is on the first island.







The second circular pod is on the second island.









The third circular pod is on the third island.









Once you open all 3 pods, this Canister will appear.









Part 4 - The Cave

Canister 7
As you enter the cave, you'll see some black LEGO pieces on the right.








Sith Force them to create part of a bridge, then walk across it. Sith Force the other LEGO pieces to complete the bridge.







Cross the gap and you'll see this Canister on the upper ledge. To reach it, destroy the silver boxes on the left to reveal LEGO pieces.







Build them into a grapple point, then use it to reach the ledge with this Canister.








Canister 8
You'll see a travel chute after the last floating platform.








Crawl through it to reach an upper ledge. You'll see the cage with this Canister inside across the gap.








Shoot the cage to drop it to the ground, revealing this Canister.








Canister 9
Right before the Vader fight, you'll see some silver rubble on the right side of the path. Destroy it to clear the path, then head into the alcove.







Inside the alcove, you'll find a bunch of pillars. Walk across them to cross the gap to the Canister. Be careful, as not all of the pillars are safe to stay on. If you hop on an unsafe pillar, it and other nearby pillars will shake. Quickly jump to a pillar that is not shaking and you'll be safe. This screenshot shows all of the safe pillars.
Dagobah - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 5 - Crashed X-wing

Canister 10
On the right side of the final island, you'll find a travel chute.








Crawl through it to reach the upper ledge, then hover to the left to reach the lever.








Pull it to destroy a box below you, revealing LEGO pieces.








Build them into a grapple point, then use it to grapple up onto the ledge with this Canister. Double jump up to it to reach it.







Minikit Model: X-wing
Dagobah - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Force, Hover, Sith Force

Part 1 - Dagobah Swamps

Blue Canister 1
As you approach the swamp, you'll notice a black gate to the right.








Sith Force it to clear the path, then hover across the gap.








You'll find a small racetrack, with this Blue Canister right in the middle.








Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found on one of the small islands in the swamp. Hover to it to collect it.








Part 2 - Yoda's Hut

Blue Canister 3
You'll find this Blue Canister to the left of Yoda's hut. Force the LEGO pieces from Yoda's hut to create a platform, allowing you to reach this.







Blue Canister 4
Head to the right of Yoda's hut and you'll find a red box. Sith Force it to reveal LEGO pieces.








Build them into a raft, then hop on and ride it over to the area with this Blue Canister.








Part 3 - Training Grounds

Blue Canister 5
Since you're not in Story Mode, you won't automatically go to the training grounds. You'll have to head inside yourself. Head to the left of Yoda's hut and you'll see this tree. Head through the gap in the roots to reach the training grounds.





This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the final island.








Part 4 - The Cave

Blue Canister 6
When you enter the cave you'll find some LEGO pieces you can Sith Force.








Sith Force them to create part of a bridge, then walk on it and Sith Force the LEGO pieces across the gap to create the other half. Cross the bridge to reach this Blue Canister.






Blue Canister 7
On the upper ledge ledge is an Astromech panel.









Hop up the ledges to reach the panel, then use it to open the gate to this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the room where you fight Vader.








Part 5 - Crashed X-wing

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found on the right side of the first island, before you cross the bridge.








Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is on the left by the boxes you Force up to reach the ledge.
Cloud City Trap - Story Mode
Barely a few weeks into his Jedi training with Yoda, Luke Skywalker has had a vision of his friends captured by Darth Vader.

Against Yoda's advice, the impetuous young Jedi sets his X-wing fighter on a course for Cloud City.

Here he hopes to find Han Solo and Princess Leia - little guessing in his haste that he himself is the true target of Vader's trap....

Enemies: Stormtrooper
Boss: Darth Vader
Starting Characters: Luke Skywalker (Bespin), R2-D2
True Jedi: 14,000

Part 1 – Landing Pad

Well, we’re here to rescue Han and Leia. Nothing can go wrong! We’ve got to get to that door on the right. Force part of your X-wing to create a platform, but you still can’t make it to the other side. Have R2 hover over to the ledge on the left and use the Astromech panel.

This will extend another platform, allowing Luke to reach the door. Hop across the gap and build the LEGO pieces into an Astromech panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside.

Part 2 – Freezing Chamber Approach

The door on the right is blocked off by a blue barrier. To destroy it, we’ll need a turret. Use the Astromech panel to open the door, revealing a large box. Push it along the tiles into the red slot, then destroy the white object on the left to reveal LEGO pieces.

Build them into a turret, then Force it onto the slot. Hop in the turret and use it to destroy the blue barrier, opening the door. Continue down the hallway and use the Astromech panel to open the door, then head inside.

Part 3 – Carbonite Freezing Chamber

Head to the right and down the stairs. Vader will then appear! Duel him to take out two hearts. He will then jump onto one of the grey panels around the area. If you try to approach him, he will jump to a different panel. When he is standing on a panel, use the Astromech panel to activate the carbonite jets, temporarily freezing Vader in place. This will give you a free hit, so use it to take another heart off Vader. He will then attack you again. Repeat this process two more times to take out his health.

He will then retreat through the door on the right. Some LEGO pieces will also drop. Build them into a crane, then hop in and use it to pick up R2. Drop him off across the gap to the right (don’t try to hover across the gap, you won’t make it). He will then use the Astromech panel, extending a platform that allows you to double jump across the gap.

Before crossing, head back to the left and grab a stormtrooper helmet from the Hat Machine. Head back to the left and cross the gap, then use the Imperial panel to open the door. Head inside.

Part 4 – Pursuing Vader

Head to the right and Force the LEGO pieces into a fan. Before riding the current to the top ledge, continue to the right and use the Astromech panel. This will start a platform moving above you. Ride the air current to the upper ledge, then catch a ride on the moving platform. Hop off onto the ledge with Vader, who will then hop away.

Step on the grey platform to the left of you. This will lower it, allowing R2 to hover over to you. Once R2 is with you, Force the fan to the right, then ride the air current up onto the ledge. Use the Astromech panel to start the platform moving, then ride it up to the ledge. Head inside the door.

Part 5 – Maintenance Room

Time for another fight with Vader. Duel him to take out two hearts. He will then jump onto a platform above you. Force the triangles on the left to create a ramp, allowing R2 to reach the upper ledge. Use the Astromech panel to activate the carbonite jets, forcing Vader back to the ground.

Duel him again to take out two hearts. He will again retreat. Build the LEGO pieces on the right into a generator and rotary handle. R2 will then head over to the lift. Turn the rotary handle to raise him up, allowing him to use the Astromech panel to force Vader back down.

Repeat this process one more time to take out Vader’s hearts. He will then retreat through the door on the right. Follow him.

Part 6 – The Window

Head to the right and you’ll see Vader across the gap. There will be two Stormtroopers shooting at you. You can deflect the blasts at them, but they’ll keep coming. You need to cut off the supply. Hover across the gap and use the Astromech panels to shut the hatches.

Some objects will then appear. Vader will begin Forcing them at Luke. Hover back across the gap and switch to Luke. When Vader Forces something at you, Force it back to hit him. He will then hop over and duel you, so take out two hearts.

He will then hop back and more stormtroopers will appear. Repeat this process two more times and he will retreat through the window. Force the LEGO pieces that he leaves behind into a platform, allowing you to double jump across the gap. Pursue Vader through the window.

Part 7 – Family Reunion

Time to finish this! Take two hearts off Vader and he will hop to the next platform. Force the LEGO pieces on the wall into a ramp, allowing you to reach the next platform. Take another two hearts off and he will retreat to the right.

Hover to the right, then use the Astromech panel to raise up the platform, allowing you to reach Vader. Follow Vader and take out his last six hearts to complete the level.

Unlocked Characters: Luke Skywalker (Bespin)
Cloud City Trap - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Hover, Imperial, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Landing Pad

Red Power Brick (Score x6)
You can find this Power Brick behind bars by the Astromech panel. Use a thermal detonator to destroy the bars, allowing you to collect this Power Brick.






Canister 1
This can be found to the right of the Astromech panel on a ledge. Simply hover over to it to collect it.







Part 2 - Freezing Chamber Approach

Canister 2
Use the Bounty Hunter panel on the left side of the hallway to open the door. Head inside and you'll find this Canister in the center of the room.







Part 3 - Carbonite Freezing Chamber

Canister 3
After you build the crane, you will be able to Sith Force the lever. Do so to open up the carbonite freezing chamber.







After you do this, two stormtroopers will appear. Hop in the crane and pick one of them up, then drop them in the hole.







This will reveal some LEGO pieces, which you can build into this Canister.








Part 4 - Pursuing Vader

Canister 4
This Canister can be found on the platform you reach by riding the current of the first fan. Shoot the wall panel to lower a platform, then hop onto it to reach this Canister. You can also just do a Jedi Slam underneath the Canister to collect it.





Canister 5
This Canister can be found floating in the air above the second fan. Once you ride the current onto the ledge, simply double jump to the left to reach this.







Part 5 - Maintenance Room

Canister 6
You'll find this Canister behind bars on the left side of the room. Crawl through the travel chute on the right to reach it.







Part 6 - The Window

Canister 7
On the bottom right corner of the platform, you'll see a panel made of LEGO pieces. Use a thermal detonator to destroy the panel. This Canister will then rise up out of the hole.






Part 7 - Family Reunion

Canister 8
This Canister can be found immediately to the left of your starting point.








Canister 9
This Canister can be seen in the foreground while you're on the second platform. Simply double jump or hover over to it. There is a platform underneath the Canister that you can land on after you collect it.





Canister 10
Use the Imperial panel to open the door, then head inside to find this Canister.








Minikit Model: Cloud Car
Cloud City Trap - Challenge Mode
Part 1 - Landing Pad

Blue Canister 1
This Blue Canister can be found on top of your X-wing.








Part 2 - Freezing Chamber Approach

Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found to the right of the door blocked off by the blue barrier.








Part 3 - Carbonite Freezing Chamber

Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the carbonite freezing pad.








Part 4 - Pursuing Vader

Blue Canister 4
This Blue Canister can be found right by the location of the first fan you Force together.








Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister is floating off to the right of the exit platform.








Part 5 - Maintenance Room

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister is in the bottom left corner of the room.








Part 6 - The Window

Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister is in the bottom right corner of the platform opposite the window.








Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister is on the left side of the platform with the stormtroopers.








Part 7 - Family Reunion

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister is next to the Astromech panel.









Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister is right next to the Imperial panel.
Betrayal over Bespin - Story Mode
Escaping from the Rebel defeat on Hoth, Han Solo has sought sanctuary on Cloud City, high above the planet Bespin.

His old friend Lando Calrissian is now Baron-Administrator of this self-governing colony, and Han hopes for a warm welcome.

But in this time of galactic upheaval, nothing is as it seems....

Enemies: Stormtrooper, Imperial Officer, Beach Trooper
Boss: Boba Fett
Starting Characters: Lando Calrissian, Chewbacca, Princess Leia (Bespin)
Added Characters: R2-D2, C-3PO
True Jedi: 34,000

Part 1 – Bounty Hunter Pursuit

If we hurry, we might be able to save Han! Head down the hallway after Boba Fett. He will then pull a lever, turning the staircase into a ramp. Destroy the white panel on the left to reveal another lever, then pull it to turn the ramp back into stairs. Head up the stairs and into the next room.

You’ll see Boba Fett enter the room on the right, so follow him. You will now have a little shootout. You’ll need to shoot him once to shut off his jetpack, then shoot him again to damage him. He will then get back up on his jetpack.

After you take him down to one heart, he will flee, so follow him out of the room. He will then use the Bounty Hunter panel to open the door, so follow him. Head to the left down the hallway and follow Boba Fett all the way to the landing pad.

After the cutscene, you’ll have R2 added to the party. Head back inside. Head down the hallway and you’ll find it blocked by gas. R2 can pass through without a problem, but everyone else will die as soon as they touch it. Use the Astromech panel to shut off the gas, then continue down the hallway.

Use the Astromech panel at the end to open the door, then head inside, where you'll find some of 3PO's pieces. The Ugnaughts in here will stun R2 if they get a chance, so defeat them to spare you the trouble. Destroy the objects in the room to clear the space by the tiles, then push the generator into the slot. This will power up the lever, so pull it to reveal more of C-3PO’s pieces. Destroy the purple object by the conveyor belt to reveal his head.

Once all the pieces are revealed, build them into C-3PO, adding him to your party. Head back out of the room, then use the Protocol panel on the left to open the door. Head inside and continue down the hallway. Grab a stormtrooper helmet from the Hat Machine, then continue left down the hallway. Use the Imperial panel in the elevator on the right to go up.

Part 2 – Cloud City Exterior

Head forward and you will be faced with a horde of enemy stormtroopers. Defeat the enemies that appear and some LEGO pieces will fall from the sky. Build them into a grapple point, then use it to cross the gap. Hop in the crane and use it to carry R2 and 3PO across the gap. Use the grapple point to reach the upper ledge, then build the LEGO pieces into a lever. Pull it to lower the elevator, allowing R2 and 3PO to join you.

Continue to the right and you’ll find a little conveyor belt. Running through the red light will start the belt moving. This will trap 3PO, as he isn’t fast enough to continue, so step on the button to shut off the conveyor belt. Continue to the right and you’ll find a grey object in the path. Lando, Leia and Chewie can hop over it, and R2 can hover around it by following the studs. 3PO however, is trapped. Leave him for now, as we’ll come back for him.

Hover across the next gap, then use the Astromech panel to extend a bridge, allowing Lando, Leia and Chewie to join you. Grapple up onto the ledge, then head to the left and shoot the object on the wall. This will destroy the grey object in the path, allowing 3PO to continue to the right. Destroy the blue box by the Protocol panel, then push the orange boxes out of the way so 3PO can pass. Use the Protocol panel to open the door.

Head inside and continue down the hallway into the next room. The way ahead is blocked by gas, so head through it as R2 and use the Astromech panel to shut it off. Continue down the hall into the next room.

Part 3 – Landing Pad Control Room

There are two levers here for you to pull, but they’re shut off at the moment. Step on each pair of buttons in the room to power a lever. Once both are powered up, pull them to raise the bridge to the Falcon. Once that’s done, head back down the hallway.

Part 2 – Cloud City Exterior

Head back down the hall and into the room. Head to the left to find the door to the landing pad. Use the Astromech panel to open it, then head outside.

Part 4 – Falcon Fight

Head towards the Falcon and you’ll be attacked by a whole host of stormtroopers. Defeat the waves that come at you. Once all the enemies are defeated, the ramp to the Falcon will open. Head inside to complete the level.

Unlocked Characters: Lando Calrissian, Princess Leia (Bespin), Lobot (11,000), Ugnaught (36,000), Bespin Guard (15,000), Princess Leia (Prisoner) (22,000)
Betrayal over Bespin - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Bounty Hunter, Double Jump, Force, Hover, Protocol, Sith Force

Part 1 - Bounty Hunter Pursuit

Canister 1
Use the Protocol panel to the left of your starting point to open the door. Head inside and you'll find this Canister in the center of the room.







Canister 2
You need to build 3 fountain sculptures. The first can be found in the center of the path on the way to the staircase/ramp.







The second can be found right before the door to the landing pad.








Canister 3
Inside the room with the Boba Fett boss fight, there is a glass structure in the center.








Force it to reveal a hole in the floor, then drop down to collect this Canister.








Canister 4
There is an Astromech panel just to the left of the Bounty Hunter panel Boba Fett uses. Use it to open the door, then head inside.







Inside, you'll find two panels on the wall and a lever. Pull the lever to lower the far left panel.








Your partner will then Force the other panel, allowing you to hop up to this Canister.








Red Power Brick (Minikit detector)
Follow Boba Fett to the landing pad and you'll see that the Slave I is still here. While you can't rescue Han, you can find this Power Brick!







Canister 5
In the elevator on the left, you'll find a Bounty Hunter panel. Use it to head up to the roof.








Here, you'll find three palm trees.









Destroy the palm trees, then Force the pots on the right to reveal this Canister.








Canister 6
Before using the Imperial panel in the elevator to reach the next area, head to the right and you'll see some tables.







Force the chairs by each of the three tables to reveal this Canister.








Part 2 - Cloud City Exterior

Canister 7
This one is sneaky. As soon as you enter this area, turn around and you'll find this Canister in the front right corner.







Canister 8
This Canister can be seen to the right of the ledge you grapple up to by the Astromech panel. Simply hover over to it to collect it.







Canister 2 cont.
The pieces for the third sculpture can be found in the hallway as you approach the room with the door to the landing pad. Once you build all 3, this Canister will appear by the third sculpture you built.






Canister 9
There is a red wall panel on the right side of the room with the entrance to the landing pad. Sith Force it open the door.







Head inside and you'll find this Canister on the table.








Part 4 - Falcon Fight

Canister 10
This Canister can be found on top of the Falcon. Simply double jump up to reach it.








Minikit Model: Slave I
Betrayal over Bespin - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Double Jump, Grapple, Hover, Protocol

Part 1 - Bounty Hunter Pursuit

Blue Canister 1
To the left of your starting point is a Protocol panel. Use it to open the door, then head inside to find this Blue Canister.







Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the room where you fight Boba Fett.








Blue Canister 3
You'll find this Blue Canister in the hallway as you approach the Slave I landing pad.








Blue Canister 4
In Challenge Mode, you'll actually find the Slave I parked on the landing pad. This Blue Canister is to the right of it.







Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister can be found near the Astromech panel you use to open the door to the room with 3PO's pieces.







Part 2 - Cloud City Exterior

Blue Canister 6
This Blue Canister can be found on top of the elevator you lower for the droids.








Blue Canister 7
Use the grapple point by the Astromech panel to reach the ledge with this Blue Canister on it.








Blue Canister 8
Before you enter the final room, you'll find a grapple point on the floor.








Use it to grapple up onto the ledge in the back left. Hover over to the ledge in the front right to reach this Blue Canister.







Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found in the hallway that leads to Part 3.








Part 4 - Falcon Fight

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the landing pad.
Character Bonus - Bespin
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

In the dangerous corridors of Cloud City, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

This is one of the harder character bonuses, usually taking me around 2-3 minutes to complete. This area is very spread out, so shooting around wildly actually hurts you here, as you will often destroy things before you can get to them and collect their studs. Also, for some reason I have a hard time destroying the little fences with a blaster character, as the shots always seem to hit the wrong spots. Anyway, destroy the boxes and silver objects for the occasional Power Up. The Imperial Officers will also drop purple studs when defeated, so if you see any, focus on defeating them.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
Minikit Bonus - Hoth
While the Rebel Alliance struggles heroically with the oppressive Empire, and Luke Skywalker moves closer to his epic destiny, daily life goes on across the galaxy.

On the frozen planet Hoth, intrepid adventurers compete to collect one million LEGO Studs in the fastest time possible.

It's the desperate, ruthless life of a world in turmoil....

This minikit bonus is really easy. Destroy the brown trees and torpedo targets to reveal Power Ups. There are a lot of brown trees around the area, so you should never run out of Power Ups. There is a bomb dispenser that you can use to get bombs to tow into the barriers. While the barriers give out an insane amount of studs, I wouldn't bother with destroying them. The only exception to this is if you have the Droideka minikit (collect all Canisters in Droid Factory) and the Self destruct extra (found in Hoth Battle). This allows you to detonate the Droideka by the barriers, destroying them instantly. If you don't have them, don't worry, as the trees will give you plenty of studs.

If you fail to complete this level within 5 minutes, you will not receive the Gold Brick. You will not get to keep the studs you collect in this level.
-----Episode VI - Return of the Jedi-----
Jabba's Palace - Story Mode
Luke Skywalker has returned to his home planet of Tatooine in an attempt to rescue his friend Han Solo from the clutches of the vile gangster Jabba the Hutt.

Little does Luke know that the Galactic Empire has secretly begun construction on a new armored space station even more powerful than the first dreaded Death Star.

When complete, this ultimate weapon will spell certain doom for the small band of Rebels struggling to restore freedom to the galaxy....

Enemies: Gamorrean Guard
Boss: Rancor
Starting Characters: Princess Leia (Boushh), Chewbacca
Added Characters: Luke Skywalker (Jedi), C-3PO, R2-D2, Han Solo (Skiff)
True Jedi: 43,000

Part 1 – Entering the Palace

Time to infiltrate the palace! Walk up to the gate and you will see three gold studs floating in front of it. Collect each of the studs (build the LEGO pieces into a platform to collect the center one) and a camera droid will appear and start shooting at you. Destroy each of the camera droids (each takes 4 hits) to open the gate.

Continue inside the palace, where you will be pestered by Gamorrean Guards. Pull the levers to close off the tubes that they slide out of. This will cut them off, allowing you to continue in peace. The gate ahead is shut, but there is a Bounty Hunter panel to the left of it. Thankfully, we came impersonating a bounty hunter, but we’re missing the final piece.

Head through the door on the left and you’ll find a Hat Machine. This Hat Machine gives out Boushh's helmet. This helmet not only makes you a Bounty Hunter, it also gives you thermal detonators! Be careful, as losing the hat will take away these special privileges.

Head back to the gate and use the Bounty Hunter panel to raise it, then continue up the stairs. Head into this next room and you’ll meet up with Luke, adding him to your party. Build the LEGO pieces by the door into a Bounty Hunter panel, then use it to open the door. Head into the next room.

Part 2 – Droid Processing

First thing I recommend doing is heading to the left and taking care of the Gamorrean tube. Once they’re taken care of, head to the right side of the room, where you’ll find a weird LEGO object. Destroy it to reveal LEGO pieces, then build them into a panel. Chewie will automatically hop on, so Force the platform up to send him up and over the ledge into the room with the levers.

The gate will raise up once Chewie is inside, so pull the levers to raise the gate in front of the silver objects. Destroy them to clear the path (if you need another hat, there is a Hat Machine by the start of this area), then continue into the next room.

Head to the right and you’ll find another shut gate. It’s being held shut by the two clamps on the side of it, so destroy the orange objects to release the clamps. This will open the gate, so continue down the path. Watch out for the grey tiles on the floor, as they will fall into the abyss below when you step on them (and take you down with them if you aren't fast enough!).

Continue down the stairs and you’ll reach the room where R2 and 3PO are being kept. We need to free them to leave this room. On the left side of the room are some LEGO pieces attached to the wall. Force them off to create a pile of LEGO pieces, then build them into a platform. Next, pull the levers on the right side of the room to reveal two sets of LEGO pieces. Build them into buttons.

These buttons will allow you to control the platform you built earlier. Move the platform next to each of the droid cages. This will allow you to double jump from the platform to the inside of the cage, where your weight will lower the droids to the ground. Once both droids are free, use the Protocol and Astromech panels to open the door. Head up the stairs, then use the Astromech panel to open the door.

Part 3 – Palace Basement

Our goal in this area is to get to the door in the upper left. First things first, head to the right and pull the lever to shut off the Gamorrean tube. With that taken care of, you need to get onto the ledges. To do that, push the three pillars into the slots to the left of the Gamorrean tube. The tallest pillar goes on the left. With the three pillars in place, Force each of them to create a ramp.

Walk up the ramp, then destroy the nodes to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a small platform, then Force it into place. Force the LEGO pieces on the opposite wall to complete the bridge, then cross. I suggest pulling the lever to shut off the other Gamorrean tube, finally giving you some peace.

Hover across the gap to the left, then use the Astromech panel to extend a bridge. Cross it and continue to the gate, then destroy the nodes to reveal LEGO pieces. Build them into a Protocol panel, then use it to open the door. Head through.

Part 4 – Throne Room Entrance

Head down the stairs and you will be faced with a bunch of Gamorrean Guards. The way to Jabba’s throne room is sealed behind a gate. To open the gate, you need to defeat all of the Gamorreans. There are two Gamorrean tubes in this area, so pull the levers to shut them both. Once all the Gamorreans are goners, the gate will open. Grab a helmet from the Hat Machine on the right if you need it, then head into the throne room.

Part 5 – Jabba’s Throne Room

Simply head over to Han’s carbonite block and use the Bounty Hunter panel.

Part 6 – The Pit

Well that didn’t go as planned. You’ve got the whole party minus Leia, however, Han has been added in her place. We need to take out the Rancor (who is named Pateesa). In order to damage him (yes, it’s a him), you need to distract him, and what better way to distract a rancor than with some tasty Gamorreans.

There are two panels in the pit, a Protocol panel on the left and an Astromech panel on the right. Using a panel (it doesn’t matter which one you use) will call in a Gamorrean. The rancor will pick it up and eat it while standing next to a box. Shoot the box to take out a heart.

First, the rancor will stand by the box on the left, then the box on the right. Call in a third Gamorrean and the rancor will stand under the gate. Pull the levers to shut the gate on the rancor, killing him and ending the level.

Unlocked Characters: Princess Leia (Boushh), Luke Skywalker (Jedi), Han Solo (Skiff), Gamorrean Guard (40,000), Bib Fortuna (16,000), Palace Guard (14,000), Bossk (75,000)

You will also unlock Chewbacca, C-3PO, and R2-D2 if you haven’t already
Jabba's Palace - Free Play Mode
Required Abilities: Astromech, Double Jump, Grapple, Hover, Imperial, Protocol, Sith Force, Small, Thermal Detonator

Part 1 - Entering the Palace

Canister 1
To the left of the gate to the palace, you'll find a pile of silver rocks. Destroy them to reveal a grapple point.







Use it to grapple onto the ledge, then hover over to the ledge with this Canister.








Canister 2
Head towards the screen on the left side of the area and you'll find a pile of black rocks. Sith Force them to reveal a grapple point, then use it to grapple onto the ledge.






Head to the left and you'll find another grapple point.








Use it to reach a ledge overlooking this Canister. Drop down to the left to land on the ledge. To return to the palace entrance, build the LEGO pieces into a grapple point, which you can use to swing back across the gap.





Canister 3
To the right of the gate with the Bounty Hunter panel, you'll find a doorway.








Head inside to enter a small room with a pile of LEGO pieces inside. Build them into a Protocol panel, then use it to open the door, allowing you to collect this Canister.






Red Power Brick (Super zapper)
This Red Power Brick can be found in the room where you meet up with Luke. On the right side of the room you'll find a button. Build the pile of LEGO pieces into a box, then push it to the left so it covers the button.





This will reveal a grapple point, allowing you to grapple up onto the ledge where this Power Brick is.







Canister 4
On the left side of the room where you meet Luke is an Astromech panel.








Use it to open the door, revealing this Canister.









Part 2 - Droid Processing

Canister 5
You can see this Canister underneath the floor on the right side of the first room. You can use the nearby Protocol panel to open the door, but you can't destroy the hatch to reach the Canister. We'll have to go the long way around.





To the left of the gate with the silver rubble, you'll find a travel chute.








Crawl through it to enter the next room, then destroy the bed inside to reveal another travel chute.







Crawl through that travel chute to reach yet another room. Destroy the bed, as well as the panel in the floor underneath it, to open the door to the room.







With the panel destroyed, you can now enter the tunnel. Head to the right, then destroy the silver rubble to clear the way to this Canister.







Canister 6
After passing through the clearing blocked by the silver objects, you'll find this Canister behind some bars. Build the LEGO pieces into a bomb, then attack it a few times to destroy it. This will blow a hole in the wall, allowing you to walk up the stairs to this Canister.




Canister 7
As you enter the room with the droids, you will notice a bunch of brown panels on the floor.








Destroy them and you'll reveal the entrance to a tunnel. Head inside and follow it to the left to reach this Canister.







Part 3 - Palace Basement

Canister 8
You'll find this Canister trapped behind a panel to the left of the upper Gamorrean tube.








Sith Force the two torches surrounding it, then Sith Force the panel to destroy it, allowing you to collect this Canister.
Jabba's Palace - Free Play Mode cont.
Part 5 - Jabba's Throne Room

Canister 9
There is an Imperial panel on the left side of the throne room. The simple thing to do is use an Imperial character, but there is another way.







To the right of Han's carbonite block is a Hat Machine that gives out stormtrooper helmets. Put one on and you can use the Imperial panel.







Using the Imperial panel will open a door, revealing this Canister guarded by a Gamorrean.








Part 6 - The Pit

Canister 10
There are some LEGO pieces for a grapple point on the right side of the pit.








Build them into a grapple point, then use it to reach the upper ledge, where you can double jump up to the ledge with this Canister.







Minikit Model: Desert Skiff
Jabba's Palace - Challenge Mode
Required Abilities: Force, Grapple, Sith Force, Small

Part 1 - Entering the Palace

Blue Canister 1
To the left of your starting point, you'll find a pile of black rocks.








Sith Force them to reveal a grapple point, then use it to grapple up onto the ledge.








Continue to the left and you'll find another grapple point.








Use it to reach the upper ledge, then drop down to the left, where you'll find this Blue Canister. Build the nearby pile of LEGO pieces to reveal another grapple point, allowing you to get back to the palace gate.





Blue Canister 2
This Blue Canister is to the right of the palace gate.









Blue Canister 3
This Blue Canister can be seen behind the wall in the room with the Hat Machine. Simply walk around the wall to reach it.







Blue Canister 4
On the right side of the room where you meet Luke, you'll find a circular panel on the wall.








Force it to move it out of the way, revealing this Blue Canister.








Part 2 - Droid Processing

Blue Canister 5
This Blue Canister can be found inside a cage on the left side of the first room. To reach it, crawl through the travel chute to the left of the gate with the silver objects behind it.






This will place you inside the room on the left. Destroy the blue bed, then crawl through the next travel chute.







This will place you inside the room with this Blue Canister.








Blue Canister 6
You can find this Blue Canister on one of the falling grey panels in the floor. Be careful when collecting it, as you can fall into the abyss below!







Blue Canister 7
This Blue Canister can be seen under the floor in the room where you find R2 and 3PO. Destroy the brown panels to reveal the entrance to a tunnel. Head inside to reach this.






Part 3 - Palace Basement

Blue Canister 8
This Blue Canister can be found in the corner of the room underneath the bridge you construct using LEGO pieces.







Part 5 - Jabba's Throne Room

Blue Canister 9
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the throne room, near the Imperial panel.








Part 6 - The Pit

Blue Canister 10
This Blue Canister can be found on the left side of the pit.
The Great Pit of Carkoon - Story Mode
Work continues on the new Death Star, and the future of the galaxy appears increasingly bleak. On Tatooine, Luke Skywalker is in the grip of Jabba the Hutt, along with Han Solo, Chewbacca, and Princess Leia.

Jabba takes his prisoners across the Tatooine dunes to the Great Pit of Carkoon, where he plans to feed them to the fearsome Sarlacc beast.
